analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the text of the Paṭṭhāna in pairs of opposites
The short section in pairs, the section on causes

original: Naappaccayaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaccayo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Naappaccayaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaccayo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhataṁ sappaccayasadisaṁ.)🔽Nasanidassanaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassano hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na appaccayam na hetum dhammam paṭicca sappaccayaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na appaccayam na na hetum dhammam paṭicca sappaccayaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka saṅkhatam sappaccaya sadisa  na sanidassanam na hetum dhammam paṭicca anidassanaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With non-condition as condition, a conditionable phenomenon that is a cause arises by way of conditionality. (In brief.) In the case of cause, there is one … in the case of the unspecific, there is one.🔽With non-condition as condition, a conditionable phenomenon that is not a cause arises by way of conditionality. (In brief.) In the case of cause, there is one … in the case of the unspecific, there is one. (The formed with condition is similar.)🔽With non-manifestation as condition, a phenomenon that is a cause arises by way of conditionality. (In brief.) In the case of cause, there is one … in the case of the unspecific, there is one.

original: Nasanidassanaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassano nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na sanidassanam na na hetum dhammam paṭicca sanidassanaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With non-manifestation as condition, a phenomenon that is not a cause arises by way of conditionality. (In brief.) In the case of cause, there are three … in the case of the object, there is one … in the case of the unspecific, there are three.

original: Nasappaṭighaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca appaṭigho hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nasappaṭighaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaṭigho nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Narūpiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca arūpī hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na sappaṭigham na hetum dhammam paṭicca appaṭighaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na sappaṭigham na na hetum dhammam paṭicca sappaṭighaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi  narūpim na hetum dhammam paṭicca arūpī hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā ekam pe purejāte āsevane ekam pe avigate tīṇi

original: Nalokiyaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca lokuttaro hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: na lokiyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca lokuttaraḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With a supramundane non-cause … (one) … With a mundane non-cause … (one) … (Abbreviated.) With causes … With objects … With non-hindrances … (one) …🔽With a mundane cause and a non-cause … (three) …
